prompt:
can you /scout the images listed below, and improve our existing scout.md, plan_w_docs.md, scout_plan_build.md, based on these images? key is to do so with subagent scouts... thanks! think about this.

'/Users/alexkamysz/Pictures/Screenshots/Screenshot 2025-10-17 at 20.34.58.png' '/Users/alexkamysz/Pictures/Screenshots/Screenshot 2025-10-17 at 20.34.28.png' '/Users/alexkamysz/Pictures/Screenshots/Screenshot 2025-10-17 at 20.32.59.png' '/Users/alexkamysz/Pictures/Screenshots/Screenshot 2025-10-17 at 20.38.36.png' /Users/alexkamysz/Pictures/Screenshots/scout.md_indydevdan.png '/Users/alexkamysz/Pictures/Screenshots/Screenshot 2025-10-17 at 20.51.20.png' '/Users/alexkamysz/Pictures/Screenshots/Screenshot 2025-10-17 at 20.52.02.png'

launch a bunch of scout subagents... one as haiku scout to analyze the whole repo and create a
  summary if all the basic info and critical details, tree, function map, etc... basically what an
  LSP would do... read the docs to see what's in them, etc... how slugs are added if at all, are
  there engineering best practices and failsafes in place,
    what gaps do we have?...all the higher level engineering (wyszsza szkola jazdy)then write that
  report using haiku...the goal is not deep understanding, but structured reference documentation
  that another agent could ingest and use to enhance it's understanding...  and structure it
  according to best practices (or those dictated in this repo). explain every step we take, so we can
  map out the full repo and what's going on...curious to see our thought process and this repo in
  action!

  then, when that completes,  /sc:analyze and plz look at this entire repo, and  assess where we're
  at, how slugs are added if at all, are there engineering best practices and failsafes in place,
  what gaps do we have?...all the higher level engineering (wyszsza szkola jazdy)
    where we're at with the agents sdk... how to use that with this, how to make a basic agent
  loop...
    lot's of text... natural language helpers... but let's get the bare basics down first...think
  HARD like a senior AI dev, lmk what other info u need. Brutal bias for shipping which means
  trimming fat,... and consider where (if anywhere pydantic should exist if it doesn't already...
  sprinkle in a little security at the end too. tysm!
